result.execSummary:
The defendant Reese S. Andresen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with A.M.D.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant is to comply with all terms of Waushara County case 2016CV31.   Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to huber privileges and good time credit.

Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.   Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 16CM80 & 16CM180 Cases called @ 10:31 a.m. Defendant Reese S. Andresen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Reese S. Andresen in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. The parties stipulate to 78 days CFTS. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. No statement by DE. Court orders: 16CM80: 90 days WC Jail - 78 days CFTS, Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid w/ 60 DTP or PP. 16CM180:  195 days WC Jail concurrent w/ 16CM80- Huber, GT, 78 days CFTS - Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.  Atty Szilagyi requesting DE the opportunity to report to jail due to the impending birth of his child. The Court respectfully declines to grant the request for the furlough.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 30, 2017 at 10:15 am.

11:07 am cases called-16CM80 & 16CM180. Defendant Reese S. Andresen in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zilles makes statement to Court regarding discussion with defendant prior to going of record.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 16CM80 & Count 2 of 16CM180.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 16CM180. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. If revoked-3 days credit. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with A.M.D. Comply with all terms of Waushara County Case 16CV31. Anger Management and follow through. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond posted to be applied.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
State's
Defendant's
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Paul Zilles
Initial appearance on May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2016CM000080 and 2016CM000180.  Defendant must adhere to requirements of Waushara Co Case No. 2016CV000031.
Defendant and SPD Szilagyi

16CM-80 and 16CM-180 - Both Cases Called @ 1:39 PM: Defendant Reese S. Andresen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   PC found by the Court.  ADA argues as to bond recommendations - argues from some cash bond in the area of $500-$1000 w/conditions.  SPD argues as to bond and speaks to nonappearance.  Requests lesser cash bond.  Def is prepared to reside with relative here in Waushara Co and provides address.  Court orders cash bond as to both matters.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Body Only with Statewide Extradition
and Statement of Loss/Damage

Case Called @ 11:55 AM: Defendant Reese S. Andresen not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, bench warrant authorized with Extradition Within the State of Wisconsin.
Reese Andresen requesting to appear by phone for hearings on March 8, 2016. Clerk left message via phone advising that personal appearance required.
